content.raw:
In Drake we actually played with a very simple prototype to do exactly this. You can refer for instance to the example test [sdf_parser_test.cc](https://github.com/RobotLocomotion/drake/blob/master/multibody/parsing/test/sdf_parser_test.cc). In particular, I think it'd be useful to generally be able to do [`GetPose()`](https://github.com/RobotLocomotion/drake/blob/master/multibody/parsing/test/sdf_parser_test.cc#L128) as done in this example. That is, requesting a pose in general requires you specifying two frames A and B in order to get pose `X_AB` of frame B in frame A (sorry, I am using the monogram notation we widely adopted in Drake, [docs here](https://drake.mit.edu/doxygen_cxx/group__multibody__spatial__pose.html))

This little prototype uses this [`FrameCache`](https://github.com/RobotLocomotion/drake/blob/master/multibody/parsing/frame_cache.h) in order to take care of the proper chained transformations take place. It is not complete though, I believe special care must be taken for kinematic loops unintentionally created by a user, but it'd be a start.
